text: On the topic of multilingual sites, what does everyone here use for location detection?  I'm trying to work out a good way to go a little deeper than country by country for multi-lingual countries.

You can detect the language of a user's browser in js with `navigator.language` or `navigator.languages`: <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorLanguage/language> <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/NavigatorLanguage/languages>
Not super consistent across browsers though
This information is in the user's HTTP headers also, but I don't know that we can check that server-side in HubSpot
You could try to use this, then fall back on location-based guessing if it doesn't work. And simply let the user select their language preference, of course.
Though I've never tried to use HubSpot's new multilingual stuff, so maybe there's better stuff you can do.
